Articles.Content:
Here are two more images with explanation:

 [https://imgur.com/a/E1judin](https://imgur.com/a/E1judin) This image shows the Inline Clamp-O-Tron opened on my demonstration ship.

[https://imgur.com/a/N0sVDSO](https://imgur.com/a/N0sVDSO) This Image shows the door in the back of my cockpit, and it says "Close Door" indicating that it has already been opened. Also, I hear the door opening sound when I click on the door.

I don't know if it is some weird bug, or a not made IVA.

Also, I still get stopped by an invisible hitbox in the MK1-3 command pod.

I hope this made it a bit easier to understand the images

Ah gotcha. I’ll look into it, thanks!

>

ok, also, the mk1-3 command pod still wont work right and the docking ports themselves get identified as doors

> 
> 
> Just now, DogeInSpace said:
> 
> 
> ok, also, the mk1-3 command pod still wont work right
> 

Yeah I’ll fix that too. Note the red handle at the back of the mk2 cockpit in your picture is placed there by some other mod, it’s not from FreeIva.

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, DogeInSpace said:
> 
> 
> docking ports themselves get identified as doors
> 

Do you mean for going EVA/boarding the craft?  That’s intentional.

> 
> 
> 6 minutes ago, JonnyOThan said:
> 
> 
> Yeah I’ll fix that too. Note the red handle at the back of the mk2 cockpit in your picture is placed there by some other mod, it’s not from FreeIva.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Do you mean for going EVA/boarding the craft?  That’s intentional.
> 

For the first one, that is from DE\_IVA Extension mod I think

For the second one, I mean when My ships are docked. I used the Interior view, and it showed doors for each docking port, even when I was docked.

If I’m understanding you, that’s expected too. When spaceships dock there’s still a hatch you have to open.
yeah i know but when i open the door it only opens two doors and not the extra door made by the docking port

>

> yeah i know but when i open the door it only opens two doors and not the extra door made by the docking port

Ok, sounds like there might be something messed up with the connection logic.

ok nice also is this mod compatible with kerbal planetary base systems?

Not yet; you’ll be able to unbuckle and move around but the hatches won’t work and there won’t be anything keeping you inside the parts.

> Not yet; you’ll be able to unbuckle and move around but the hatches won’t work and there won’t be anything keeping you inside the parts.

A) yes

B) decided to just do a full release, it’s up now

Hello, I also saw SWDennis' video  and wanted to try it out. Never installed a mod before so I've been reading the procedure and dependencies.  I \*think\* I got it installed and I have moduleManager logs stating that some freeIVA items did "pass". Yet I don't see a difference in-game between having the mod or not. I'm not familiarized with KSP mods but I know how to extract a zip and merge folders. I have the base game, breaking ground and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> (just for some clouds). Sorry if I'm not supposed to ask for help here.  Thanks!

> 
> 
> 33 minutes ago, Woodsielord said:
> 
> 
> Hello, I also saw SWDennis' video  and wanted to try it out. Never installed a mod before so I've been reading the procedure and dependencies.  I \*think\* I got it installed and I have moduleManager logs stating that some freeIVA items did "pass". Yet I don't see a difference in-game between having the mod or not. I'm not familiarized with KSP mods but I know how to extract a zip and merge folders. I have the base game, breaking ground and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)"><abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr></abbr> (just for some clouds). Sorry if I'm not supposed to ask for help here.  Thanks!
> 

You don’t really “see” anything; just press Y while in IVA mode.  Post your logs if you need help.  Btw there is a mod manager program named <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> that will make sure everything gets installed correctly.

I keep seeing this cylinder on my kerbals and sticking out of my craft, I have 86 mods so I'm sure something is incompatible.

Anyone know whats going on here?

![51gZhbt.jpeg](https://i.imgur.com/51gZhbt.jpeg)

> 
>

> 
> 
> I keep seeing this cylinder on my kerbals and sticking out of my craft, I have 86 mods so I'm sure something is incompatible.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Anyone know whats going on here?

Known issue unfortunately, will be fixed in the next release.

> 
> 
> On 8/13/2015 at 7:03 AM, pizzaoverhead said:
> 
> 
> Free IVA! Free as in freedom: Get out of your seat while in IVA, move around inside your craft, open and close hatches.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Free IVA has now been released!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> See the main thread here for details:
> 
> 
> <iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedauthorid="40902" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed5596778965" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/210548-112-freeiva/&do=embed" style="height:197px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Features**
> 
> 
> 
> - Get out of your seat and explore your vessel from the inside.
> - Open hatches and see from one part into the next.
> - Walk around in gravity, or float through your vessel while on orbit.
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="344" width="459" data-embed-src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Qth5aNd9jqU?feature=oembed"></iframe>
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> [![pmSQwLQ.png](https://i.imgur.com/pmSQwLQ.png)](https://i.imgur.com/pmSQwLQ.png "Enlarge image")
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [Download from the main thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/210548-112-freeiva/)  
> 
> *[[Source Code](https://github.com/pizzaoverhead/FreeIva/wiki) | [Wiki](https://github.com/pizzaoverhead/FreeIva/wiki)]* 
> 
> 
> 
> If you've enjoyed this, consider donating a cup of coffee to help with late night coding:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [![btn_donate_LG.gif](https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/i/btn/btn_donate_LG.gif)](https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donations&business=MFFMZY8G9MP6A&lc=IE&item_name=Free%20IVA&item_number=kspaddon&currency_code=EUR&bn=PP-DonationsBF%3Abtn_donate_LG.gif%3ANonHosted)
> 
> 
> 
> Keys:
> 
> 
> - Y - Enter free view
> - Alt + Y - Lock view
> - F - Open/Close hatch
> - Alt + F - Open/Close connected hatch
> - W - Forward
> - S - Backward
> - A - Strafe left
> - D - Strafe right
> - Q - Roll counterclockwise
> - E - Roll clockwise
> - Shift - Upward
> - Ctrl - Downward
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Questions, comments, suggestions and ideas are welcome.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Free IVA is licenced under GPL v2. See [LICENSE](https://github.com/pizzaoverhead/FreeIva/blob/main/LICENSE) for details. All sound model and texture assets (.wav, .mu, .dae, .tga etc.) are licensed All Rights Reserved.
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> **Change log**
> 
> 
> 
> *v0.2.1* (2022-10-24)
> 
> 
> - Planetside Exploration Technologies Support. See release thread for details:
> 
> 
> <iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedauthorid="40902" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed335295992" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/210548-112-freeiva/&do=embed" style="height:197px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>
> 
> 
> *v0.2.0* (2022-10-11)
> 
> 
> - First official release. See release thread for details.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> *v0.1.0* (2021-03-01)
> 
> 
> - Updated for the latest version of KSP.
> - Added jumping
> 
> 
> 
> 
> *v0.0.4* (2019-02-06)
> 
> 
> - Added colliders to Mobile Processing Lab. It should now be possible to move around inside this part without floating through the vessel.
> - Added ability to open and close hatches in Mk. 1 spaceplane parts.
> - Can get into different seats in the same part or different parts.
> - Return to seat on leaving IVA view.
> - Fixed Mk. 1 inline cockpit being too narrow to pass through.
> - Changelog.
>
